parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To irritate, provoke, be angry. From orge; to provoke or enrage, i.e. become exasperated.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One who tortures, a tormentor, jailor. From basanizo; a torturer.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.
